record.field: ASIC_ERROR
Failure of one or more ASIC chips. This may be due to communication issues, defective chips, or loss of response in the ASIC chain.
TEMP_ERROR
Temperature out of safe range. Possible causes: insufficient ventilation, warm environment, obstructions, or faulty sensors.
FAN_ERROR
One or more fans are not working, are disconnected, or spinning below the minimum threshold. This affects cooling capacity.
PSU_ERROR
Power supply failure or communication loss. Could be due to a faulty PSU, unstable voltage, or a disconnected cable.
LOW_HASHRATE
Hashrate is lower than expected. Common causes: inactive ASICs, high temperature, hashboard failures, or firmware issues.
HASHBOARD_MISSING
One or more hashboards were not detected. Possible causes include loose connections, physical failure, or firmware problems.
EEPROM_ERROR
EEPROM read or write error. This may cause loss of settings, failed startup, or incorrect parameters.
BOOT_FAIL
The system does not complete the boot process. Possible causes: firmware corruption, control board issues, or damaged memory.
NETWORK_ERROR
No network connection. Check the cable, IP configuration, router/switch, or pool server status.
RTC_ERROR
Real-time clock error. Affects log synchronization, events, and scheduled functions.
CRC_ERROR
Cyclic redundancy check (CRC) error between the control board and hashboards. Possible causes: interference or poor contact.
NO_POWER
The device does not power on. Could be due to a faulty PSU, short circuit on hashboard, or damaged control board.
FREQ_ERROR
Error adjusting or maintaining chip operating frequency. Possible causes: incorrect EEPROM values or electrical instability.
VCORE_UNSTABLE
ASIC core voltage (Vcore) is unstable. This can compromise miner performance and stability.
PLL_UNLOCKED
The PLL circuit is not synchronizing correctly. This prevents the chips from operating at proper frequency.
TEMP_SENSOR_ERROR
Temperature sensor reading error. Possible causes: damaged, disconnected, or incompatible sensors.
FREQ_OFFSET_EXCEEDED
Chip frequency difference exceeds allowed threshold. Indicates desynchronization or defective chips.
CTRL_BOARD_INIT_FAIL
Failure during control board initialization. May be related to firmware or hardware issues.
POWER_LIMIT
Active power consumption limitation due to overcurrent or overheating prevention. Impacts performance.
COOLANT_LOW_PRESSURE
(Liquid cooling) Low pressure in the cooling circuit. May trigger protective shutdown.
COOLANT_HIGH_TEMP
(Liquid cooling) Coolant temperature is out of safe range. Risk of thermal shutdown.
OVER_TEMP_SHUTDOWN
Automatic shutdown due to excessive temperature as a protection measure. Check ventilation and dust buildup.
HASHBOARDS_UNBALANCE
Automatic shutdown due to imbalances in hashboard chips. Refer to technical support.
